value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">weighing what we know, but cannot measure. And</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the Elizabethans words after their long <del>of</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">silence, the power of words to say at last what</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">was in them, <del>corked up,</del> <del>must be</del> must have</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">given their early <del>plays</del> <del>in</del> returned them in front of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">their early plays, where, for the first time,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">they [listened?] themselves. <del>They</del> as if after ages of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">entombment, they had <del>lifted the</del> come out into the air:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as if at last, they [hiheed?] what is human life;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">what is love, what is <del>sorrow.</del> and for the <del>first</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>The</del> This knowledge was conveyed not by the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">preacher, nor by the historian. It was made audible</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">visible tangible in the <del>to see freely for</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">flesh. <del>But</del> This is a curious invention.</l>

<del xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <l><del>to be aware</del> The dramatists gave the</l>
            <l>audiences their existence. We are made aware</l>
            <l>of the 
              <choice>
                <sic>Ethn</sic>
                <corr>Elizabethan</corr>
              </choice> by the <del>fiction</del> dramatists.</l>
            <l><del>This</del> In Marlowe we see them as great</l>
          </del>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>conquerers</del> But <add place="above">if</add> the audience received this</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">extraordinary proof of their being without comment.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It was unto <del>t</del> rapture. Again & again the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-lmay" key="Lord Mayor of London">Lord Mayor</rs> [propated?] against the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">intoxication that was offered at the Playhouse.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But the attraction was irresistible.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>If we imagine</del> <del>This</del> For there at the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-rose" key="Rose, The">Rose</rs>, in</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-glob" key="Globe, The">Globe</rs>, at the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-fort" key="Fortune, The">Fortune</rs>, men & women who</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">had never seen themselves yet, whose only</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">reading was a letter, or a sermon, or an old</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">story of Knights & ladies, <del>saw</del> or perhaps</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>cd</sic>
              <corr>could</corr>
            </choice> not even read, but were [buy?] all day</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">labours, struggling; getting a livelihood in one of [illeg.]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">saw <del>the ver</del> their own lives composed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lit up, adorned: & heard, at last,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">their own daily experiences, the dreams they had</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the passions they felt, <del>the</del> spoken out loud.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in poetry.</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>[illeg.], as they</l>
            <l>were;</l>
            <l><del>making</del> joking:</l>
            <l>squalling:</l>
            <l>fighting.</l>
          </add>
